{{Infobox philosopher | name = Yukio Tsuda | birth_name = Yukio Tsuda | birth_place = [[Kanagawa, Japan]] | education = B.A., [[Yokohama National University]]
M.A., [[Southern Illinois University]]
Ph.D., Southern Illinois University | occupation = Professor, Researcher, Educator | nationality = Japan | citizenship = Japan | alma_mater = Southern Illinois University | notable_ideas = the hegemony of English, the ecology of language | notable_works = ''Language Inequality and Distortion in Intercultural Communication'' }} {{nihongo|'''Yukio Tsuda'''|津田 幸男|Tsuda Yukio|extra=born 1950 in [[Kanagawa Prefecture]][http://www.prof-tsuday.com/profile.html プロフィール] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080411144521/http://www.prof-tsuday.com/profile.html |date=April 11, 2008 }}}} is Professor Emeritus in the Graduate School of Humanities and Social Sciences at the [[University of Tsukuba]] and Director of the Institute of Peace Linguistics. He is also Professor in the Department of English at [[Matsuyama University]]. ==Education and career== Tsuda was born in [[Kanagawa]], Japan in 1950. He majored in English and graduated from [[Yokohama National University]] in 1973. He received his M.A. in [[TEFL]] (Teaching English as a Foreign Language) in 1978 and his Ph.D. in [[Speech Communication]] in 1985 from [[Southern Illinois University]] at Carbondale.Majid Tehranian (Ed.), ''Worlds Apart: Human Security and Global Governance'', New York, NY: I. B. Tauris, 1999, p. x. Tsuda held several faculty positions in his academic career. He was Associate Professor in the Faculty of Economics at [[Nagasaki University]] from 1986 to 1988. He then moved to [[Nagoya University]] where he was Associate Professor in the Institute of Languages and Cultures from 1988 to 1993 and Professor in the Department of International Communication and in the Graduate School of International Development from 1993 to 2001. Tsuda had been Professor in the Doctoral Program in Modern Cultures and Public Policies in the Graduate School of Humanities and Social Sciences at the University of Tsukuba since 2001. He retired from the University of Tsukuba and founded the Institute of Peace Linguistics in [[Ibaraki Prefecture]] in 2014. He is currently Professor in the Department of English at Matsuyama University in [[Ehime Prefecture]]. Tsuda was Visiting Professor at the [[International Research Center for Japanese Studies]] in [[Kyoto]] in 1996 Yukio Tsuda (Ed.), "The Japanese and the English Language: An Interdisciplinary Study of Anglicized (Americanized) Japan" (Special Section), ''Japan Review'', 1998, No. 10, p. 219. and at the [[College of San Mateo]] in California in 2007.Nat Friedland, "Fulbright Scholar in Residence a first for CSM," ''The San Francisco Examiner'', March 3, 2007 (http://www.sfexaminer.com/fulbright-scholar-in-residence-a-first-for-csm/). He was also [[Braj Kachru]] Fellow in the "Internationalization Forum" program in 1996 and Visiting Fellow in 1999 at the [[East-West Center]] in Honolulu, Hawaii.East-West Center (Ed.), ''Building an Asia Pacific Community'' (Annual Report 1999), Honolulu, HI: East-West Center, 2000, p. 45. Tsuda's academic interests include [[language policy]], cross-cultural [[psychoanalysis]], and international and [[intercultural communication]]. Among his publications are ''Language Inequality and Distortion in Intercultural Communication: A Critical Theory Approach'' (John Benjamins, 1986), ''Language, Education, and Intercultural Communication'' (Nagasaki University, 1988), ''Eigo Shihai-no Kouzou'' [''The Structure of the Dominance of English''] (Daisan Shokan, 1990), ''Shinryaku-suru Eigo, Hangeki-suru Nihongo'' [''The Invading English, The Counter-Attacking Japanese''] (PHP Institute, 1996), and ''Eigo Shihai-to Kotoba-no Byoudou'' [''The Hegemony of English and Linguistic Equality''] (Keio University Press, 2006). ==The Ecology of Language Paradigm== Tsuda is well known as a critic of the [[hegemony]] of English and as an advocate of linguistic and [[cultural pluralism]]. He believes that the domination of English is tantamount to [[linguicism]] and [[language death|linguicide]], and that addressing the problem of linguistic hegemony is crucial to the development of human and cultural security.Yukio Tsuda, "Anglomania Muddies Japan's Self-Image," ''Asahi Evening News'', January 23, 1997, p. 8.Yukio Tsuda, "Language Problems in Intercultural Communication: Review and Suggestions," ''Studies in Language and Culture'', Vol. 10, No. 1, 1988, pp. 17-30.Yukio Tsuda, "Speaking Against the Hegemony of English," in ''Special Research Project: Civil Society, the State and Culture in Comparative Perspective'' (Annual Report), Tsukuba, Japan: University of Tsukuba, 2005, pp. 235-244. In an article in ''The San Matean'', a San Mateo Community College newspaper, dated March 19, 2007, Tsuda was quoted to say: "It is more important to be students learning other languages than being a teacher only teaching one." He proposed the "ecology of language" paradigm as opposed to the "diffusion of English" paradigm. {{Quotation|The Diffusion of English Paradigm, which is a dominant position not only in the Anglo-American world but also in the former British colonies in Asia and Africa, is characterized by theoretical orientations such as capitalism, science and technology, modernization, monolingualism, ideological globalization and internationalization, transnationalization, Americanization, the homogenization of the world culture, and linguistic, cultural, and media imperialism. In contrast, an alternative theoretical orientation critical of the Diffusion of English Paradigm is what I call the "Ecology of Language Paradigm." This paradigm is based on the theoretical positions such as the human rights perspective, equality in communication, multilingualism, the maintenance of languages and cultures, the protection of national sovereignties, and the promotion of foreign language education.Yukio Tsuda, "The Diffusion of English: Its Impact on Culture and Communication," ''Keio Communication Review'', No. 16, March 1994, pp. 58-59.}} Tsuda urges international and intercultural communication scholars to recognize the hegemony of English as a subject of academic inquiry in the fields especially in the English-speaking countries. He also suggests that English-language teaching professionals incorporate the ecology of language paradigm into the contents and methods of teaching as well as teacher education. Finally, he insists that both native speakers and non-native speakers of English learn the philosophy of the ecology of language so that they will become more sensitive to the ethical aspects of international and intercultural communication.Yukio Tsuda, "The Hegemony of English and Strategies for Linguistic Pluralism: Proposing the Ecology of Language Paradigm," in Molefi Kete Asante, Yoshitaka Miike, and Jing Yin (Eds.), ''The Global Intercultural Communication Reader'' (2nd Ed.), New York, NY: Routledge, 2014, p. 455. == Publications == * Tsuda, Y. (1992). The dominance of English and linguistic discrimination. ''Media Development'', ''34''(1), 32-34. * Tsuda, Y. (1993). Communication in English: Is it anti-cultural? ''Journal of Development Communication'', ''4''(1), 69-78. * Tsuda, Y. (1994). The diffusion of English: Its impact on culture and communication. ''Keio Communication Review'', ''16'', 49-61. * Tsuda, Y. (1997). Hegemony of English vs. Ecology of Language: Building equality in international communication. In L. E. Smith & M. L. Forman (Eds.), ''World Englishes 2000: Selected essays'' (pp. 21–31). Honolulu, HI: College of Language, Linguistics and Literature, University of Hawaii and the East-West Center. * Tsuda, Y. (1998). Critical studies on the dominance of English and the implications for international communication. ''Japan Review'', ''10'', 219-236. * Tsuda, Y. (2000). Envisioning a democratic linguistic order. ''TESL Reporter'', ''33''(1), 32-38. * Tsuda, Y. (2000). The maintenance of the Korean language and identity in Japan. ''Studies in the Linguistic Sciences'', ''30''(1), 219-227. * Tsuda, Y. (2001). "World Englishes" as critical theory or ideology? ''Keio Communication Review'', ''23'', 3-19. * Tsuda, Y. (2002). The hegemony of English: Problems, opposing views, and communication rights. In G. Mazzaferro (Ed.), ''The English language and power'' (pp. 19–31). Alessandria, Italty: Edizionoi dell’Orso. * Tsuda, Y. (2008). English hegemony and English divide. ''China Media Research'', ''4''(1), 47-55. * Tsuda, Y. (2010). Speaking against the hegemony of English: Problems, ideologies, and solutions. In T. K. Nakayama & R. T. Halualani (Eds.), ''The handbook of critical intercultural communication'' (pp. 248–269). West Sussex, UK: Wiley-Blackwell. * Tsuda, Y. (2014). The hegemony of English and strategies for linguistic pluralism: Proposing the Ecology of Language Paradigm. In M. K. Asante, Y. Miike, & J. Yin (Eds.), ''The global intercultural communication reader'' (2nd ed., pp. 445–456). New York, NY: Routledge. == References == {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://peace-linguistics.org/index.html Institute of Peace Linguistics] *[http://miresperanto.com/en/english_as_intern/hegemony_of_english.htm The Hegemony of English and Strategies for Linguistic Pluralism: Proposing the Ecology of Language Paradigm] *[http://contentdm.lib.byu.edu/cdm4/document.php?CISOROOT=/TESL&CISOPTR=1333&REC=7 Envisioning a Democratic Linguistic Order] *[https://web.archive.org/web/20030503074459/http://www.gsid.nagoya-u.ac.jp/project/apec/outcomes/paper96/10/tsuda-en.html A Critique of English as a Common Language for APEC: Three Perspectives] *[https://www.jstage.jst.go.jp/article/jaces1962/1986/25/1986_67/_pdf English as an International Language: Convenience or Equality?] *[http://shinku.nichibun.ac.jp/jpub/pdf/jr/IJ1012.pdf Critical Studies on the Dominance of English and the Implications for International Communication] *[http://naosite.lb.nagasaki-u.ac.jp/dspace/bitstream/10069/26113/1/keizainenpo02_04.pdf Democratization of Language Choice in Intercultural Communication] *[http://naosite.lb.nagasaki-u.ac.jp/dspace/bitstream/10069/26124/1/keizainenpo04_03.pdf Language Discrimination and the Right to Language in Intercultural Communication] *[http://www.ideals.uiuc.edu/bitstream/handle/2142/9648/SLS2000v30.1-18Tsuda.pdf?sequence=2 The Maintenance of the Korean Language and Identity in Japan] {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Tsuda, Yukio}} [[Category:1950 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Japanese academics]] [[Category:Japanese educators]] [[Category:Communication theorists]] [[Category:Linguists from Japan]] [[Category:Linguistic rights]]

[[File:View over Playa La Ropa.jpg|thumb|Playa La Ropa near the site of the Zihuatanejo Project]] The '''Zihuatanejo Project''' was a psychedelic training center and [[intentional community]] created during the beginning of the [[counterculture of the 1960s]] by [[Timothy Leary]] and [[Richard Alpert]] under the umbrella of their nonprofit group, the International Federation for Internal Freedom (IFIF). The community was located in [[Zihuatanejo]], [[Guerrero]], [[Mexico]], and took up residence at the Hotel Catalina in the summers of 1962 and 1963.<ref name="Leary1964">Leary, Timothy; Richard Alpert; Ralph Metzner. 1964. "Rationale of the Mexican Psychedelic Training Center". In Richard Blum: ''Utopiates: The Use and Users of LSD-25'', 178-186. New York: Atherton Press. {{ISBN|0202363244}}.</ref>
==Background== Leary and Alpert first discovered the town of Zihuatanejo in 1960. After the [[Marsh Chapel Experiment]] in 1962 they decided the area would make a good location for a training center.<ref name="Conners"/> The idea for the community was influenced by [[Aldous Huxley]]'s fictional novel, ''[[Island (Huxley novel)|Island]]'' (1962).<ref>Greenfield, Robert. 2006. ''Timothy Leary: A Biography''. Houghton Mifflin Harcourt. {{ISBN|0-15603-206-6}}. 186.</ref><ref name="Lattin">Lattin, Don. 2011. ''The Harvard Psychedelic Club: How Timothy Leary, Ram Dass, Huston Smith, and Andrew Weil Killed the Fifties and Ushered in a New Age for America''. HarperCollins. {{ISBN|0-06165-594-5}}. 2011, 99, 112.</ref>
==Training program== Thousands of people applied to the IFIF in the hopes of joining the project in Zihuatanejo.<ref>Lee, Martin A. & Shlain, Bruce. 1992. "Preaching LSD". ''Acid Dreams: The Complete Social History of LSD: The CIA, the Sixties, and Beyond'', Grove Press, {{ISBN|0-8021-3062-3}}. 96-98.</ref> Out of this pool of applicants, a small, select group of people were chosen. Amenities cost $200 a month per person, including food and lodging in bungalows near a secluded beach. Fishermen supplied a bounty of fresh fish from the bay. During the first training session in 1962, Leary and 35 guests rented the Catalina Hotel for a month using their own version of the ''[[The Psychedelic Experience: A Manual Based on the Tibetan Book of the Dead|Tibetan Book of the Dead]]'' as a guide book for [[LSD]] sessions; [[Ralph Metzner]] and Richard Alpert helped manage the group.<ref>Dass, Ram; Metzner, Ralph; Bravo, Gary. 2010. ''Birth of a Psychedelic Culture: Conversations about Leary, the Harvard Experiments, Millbrook and the Sixties''. Synergetic Press. {{ISBN|9780907791386}}.</ref> Group LSD sessions began in the morning with the consumption of liquid LSD, with a dosage of 100 to 500 micrograms ingested by participating individuals; the experience would usually last until late afternoon.
==Closure== Immigration officials were tipped off to the project when the Mexican media began reporting stories about an "LSD Paradise". In the summer of 1963, after only six weeks (May 1 - June 16) the Mexican authorities shut the community down. Officials removed the group from Zihuatanejo and sent them to [[Mexico City]] aboard a chartered [[Douglas DC-3| DC-3]].<ref>Hollingshead, Michael. 1973. "Leary Flies his Jolly Roger from the Ivy Tower". ''The Man who Turned on the World''. Blond and Briggs. London. {{ISBN|0-85634-015-4}}. Hollingshead's account is from Dusheck, George. July 2, 1963. "Paradise Lost by Mexico LSD Colony." ''San Francisco News-Call Bulletin''.</ref> Several failed attempts were made to move the training center to Dominica and Antigua. In August 1963, with the help of wealthy patrons, Leary and their group moved to [[Millbrook, New York]], where they stayed until 1968.<ref name="Conners">Conners, Peter. 2010. ''White Hand Society: The Psychedelic Partnership of Timothy Leary & Allen Ginsberg''. City Lights Books. {{ISBN|0872865754}}.</ref><ref>Miles, Barry. 2005. ''Hippie''. Sterling Publishing Company, Inc. {{ISBN|1-4027-2873-5}}</ref><ref name="Hamilton">Hamilton, Neil A. 2002. ''Rebels and Renegades: A Chronology of Social and Political Dissent in the United States'', Taylor & Francis. {{ISBN|0-415-93639-X}}. 260-261.</ref>
==Media== Leary talks extensively about the project on the rare, out-of-print 1966 recording, ''Turn On, Tune In, Drop Out: Timothy Leary Ph.D. speaks on L.S.D.''
==References== {{reflist}}
==Further reading== {{Portal|1960s}} *Downing, Joseph J. 1964. "Zihuatanejo: An Experiment in Transpersonative Living." In Richard Blum: ''Utopiates: The Use and Users of LSD-25'', 142-77. New York: Atherton Press. {{ISBN|0202363244}}. *Fisher, Gary. 2005. "Treating the Untreatable." In Roger Walsh and Charles S. Grob: ''Higher Wisdom: Eminent Elders Explore the Continuing Impact of Psychedelics'', 103-17. Albany: State University of New York Press. {{ISBN|1423747720}}. *"No Illusions". ''Newsweek''. June 10, 1963. *[[Jay Stevens|Stevens, Jay]]. 1998, ''Storming Heaven: LSD and the American Dream'', Grove Press, {{ISBN|0-8021-3587-0}} .

Rafi Haikal |alma_mater = Krisanadwipayana University |occupation = |profession = Politician |religion = [[Sunni Islam]] |signature = |website = http://www.zulhasan.com/ |footnotes = }} '''Zulkifli Hasan''' (born 17 May 1962 in Lampung) is an [[Indonesian people|Indonesian]] politician who is currently Speaker of the [[People's Consultative Assembly|People's Consultative Assembly (MPR)]] and Chairman of the Islam-oriented [[National Mandate Party]] (PAN). He was Forestry Minister from 22 October 2009 to 1 October 2014. ==Childhood and education== Zulkifli Hasan was born to Hasan and Siti Zaenab, who were farmers in Pisang village in Penengahan, [[South Lampung Regency|South Lampung]]. In later life, he would claim to have experienced economic hardship as a child, saying he learnt to work hard by selling eggs produced on the farm. He attended a local elementary school from 1969 to 1975. At age 13, his father took him to Tanjungkarang (now called [[Bandar Lampung]]) to enroll him in junior high school level at the State Islamic Teachers Training School (PGAN), against the boy's wishes.{{cite news|title=Zulkifli Hasan: Man Jadda Wajada!|url=http://rilis.id/Zulkifli-Hasan-Man-Jadda-Wajada|accessdate=1 April 2018|publisher=RILISID|date=13 February 2017}} While attending PGAN, Zulkifli lived in a rented room in lodgings for boarders. He left PGAN in his fourth year at the school. He took an entrance exam for Madrasah Tsanawiah and passed. Without parental consent, he enrolled at Tandjungkarang State Senior High School. After four months, his father discovered he had switched schools and forced him to leave the high school. Armed with a little money from his mother, Zul moved to Jakarta. There, he attended State Senior High School 53 and graduated in 1982. In 1986, he enrolled at the Faculty of Economics at Krisnadwipayana University (Unkris) in Jakarta and financed his studies independently. In 2003, he graduated from PPM School of Management.{{cite news|title=Profil Zulkifli Hasan|url=https://www.viva.co.id/siapa/read/12-zulkifli-hasan|accessdate=3 April 2018|publisher=PT. Viva Media Baru}} == A self-made man == Having been raised in a farming family, Zulkifli was motivated to seek success beyond a rural environs. In a 2015 interview, he said his parents had wanted him to become like [[Buya Hamka]], an Islam-oriented journalist and author from Sumatra. "But I refused. I wanted to migrate to Jakarta." Arriving in Jakarta as a teenager without prior acquaintances or relatives, Zulkifli supported himself with jobs from washing taxis to selling drinks. He graduated from high school with the highest achievement in his class. He then tried his luck as a door-to-door salesman of pots and later attended college while doing business.{{cite news|last1=Kuwado|first1=Fabian Januarius|title=Zulkifli Hasan Bicara Kesuksesannya sebagai "Sales" Panci dan Reformasi PAN|url=https://nasional.kompas.com/read/2015/01/22/21413111/Zulkifli.Hasan.Bicara.Kesuksesannya.sebagai.Sales.Panci.dan.Reformasi.PAN|accessdate=3 April 2018|publisher=Kompas.com|date=22 January 2015}} After exploring various areas of business, he began working for an ethnic Chinese businessman who sold home furnishings.{{cite news|title=Kisah Dua Menteri yang Sama-Sama Putra Lampung|url=https://www.jpnn.com/news/kisah-dua-menteri-yang-sama-sama-putra-lampung?page=2|accessdate=9 April 2018|publisher=JPNN.com|date=24 October 2009}} In his later years, Zulkifli once visited Lembaga Pendidikan Insani (LPI), an educational institution whose operational costs came from Islamic donations. He told students there: "If I ate eggs and could become a minister, then you who eat chicken should be able to become president."{{cite news|last1=Widjaya|first1=M. Akbar|title=Masa Kecil Menhut Zulkifli Hasan, Makan Sebutir Telur Dibagi Delapan|url=http://www.republika.co.id/berita/nasional/umum/11/10/21/lteug3-masa-kecil-menhut-zulkifli-hasan-makan-sebutir-telur-dibagi-delapan|accessdate=1 April 2018|publisher=Republika.co.id|date=21 October 2011}} ''Bang'' (Brother) Zul, as he was known, remained close to the people of his hometown in Lampung and would present assistance in times of disaster. ==Business career== Prior to becoming a politician, Zulkifli worked as a civil servant and then started his own businesses. His father had advised him not to be a follower but to be a leader, even if that meant starting from something small, so he quit the civil service.{{cite news|title=Zulkifli Hasan, Keluar dari PNS Jadi Pengusaha Sukses|url=https://finance.detik.com/sosok/d-1943289/zulkifli-hasan-keluar-dari-pns-jadi-pengusaha-sukses|accessdate=3 April 2018|publisher=detikFinance|date=17 June 2012}} His older brother, Herli Hasan, says Zulkifli left the civil service because the salary was low.{{cite news|title=Kisah Dua Menteri yang Sama-Sama Putra Lampung|url=https://www.jpnn.com/news/kisah-dua-menteri-yang-sama-sama-putra-lampung?page=2|accessdate=9 April 2018|publisher=JPNN.com|date=24 October 2009}} Zulkifli's subsequent corporate positions included: * President Director of PT Batin Eka Perkasa (1988-2004), then Commissioner (2004-2005). A Jakarta-based company producing kitchen appliances under the Haneda brand-name; now run by Zulkifli's oldest daughter, Futri Zulya Savitri.{{cite news|title=Mengenal Futri Zulya Savitri, CEO PT Batin Eka Perkasa|url=http://indobisnis.indopos.co.id/read/2016/07/01/11333/Mengenal-Futri-Zulya-Savitri-CEO-PT-Batin-Eka-Perkasa-BEP|accessdate=4 April 2018|publisher=indopos.co.id|date=1 July 2016}} * President Director of PT Panamas Mitra Inti Lestari (1997-2004). A Bogor-based company selling home appliances and non-stick cookware.{{cite web|title=Panamas Mitra Inti Lestari PT|url=https://www.daftarperusahaan.com/bisnis/panamas-mitra-inti-lestari-pt|website=Daftarperusahaan.com|publisher=Daftarperusahaan.com|accessdate=4 April 2018}} * President Director of PT Sarana Bina Insani, Jakarta (2000-2004). A travel bureau.{{cite news|title=Zul Sudah Diajak Bicara oleh SBY|url=https://issuu.com/tribunlampung/docs/tl1209|accessdate=4 April 2018|publisher=Tribun Lampung|date=12 September 2009}} * Commissioner of PT Hudaya Safari Utama, Jakarta (2000-2006). A haj and umroh travel bureau. * Commissioner of [[PT Gudang Garam]], Jakarta (2006-2007). ===Youth entrepreneurship=== After starting his political career, he did not abandon his entrepreneurial interests. He became a motivator for young people and the wider community, particularly in Sumatra, to develop entrepreneurship and create new jobs. He encouraged rural youths to help advance Indonesia's future economic growth. In 2012, he supported a program of the National Mandate Party (PAN) that provided venture capital and training for young entrepreneurs in North Sumatra.{{cite news|last1=Suryana|first1=Dede|title=Jadi KEK, Sumut Harus Tingkatkan Wirausaha|url=https://economy.okezone.com/read/2012/05/06/320/624714/jadi-kek-sumut-harus-tingkatkan-wirausaha|accessdate=3 April 2018|publisher=Okezone.com|date=6 May 2012}} == Early political career == Zulkifli was active in the [[Muhammadiyah]] mass Muslim organization, whose members were among the founders of the [[National Mandate Party]] (PAN) in 1998. His first political forays included chairing the Regional Board of Farmers and Fishermen of Lampung Province, serving as deputy chairman of Lampung Sai Community Society, and initiating the Lampung Youth Union in Jakarta. He chaired Muhammadiyah's Institute of Agricultural Laborers and Fishermen for Jakarta from 2000 to 2005. He chaired the Logistics Department of PAN's Central Board from 2000 to 2005.{{cite news|title=Keberuntungan Zulkifli Hasan menjadi ketua MPR|url=https://www.antaranews.com/berita/457660/keberuntungan-zulkifli-hasan-menjadi-ketua-mpr|accessdate=3 April 2018|publisher=Antara|date=9 October 2014}} He later became deputy chairman of PAN's faction in the House of Representatives, serving as a member of parliament from 2004 to 2009. He was a member of House Commission VI overseeing transportation and infrastructure. In July 2008, he was elected chairman of a special committee that questioned the government's policy to raise fuel prices.{{cite news|title=Zulkifli Hasan Terpilih Jadi Ketua Pansus Hak Angket BBM|url=https://otomotif.kompas.com/read/2008/07/09/14405974/Zulkifli.Hasan.Terpilih.Jadi.Ketua.Pansus.Hak.Angket.BBM|accessdate=3 April 2018|publisher=Kompas.com|date=9 July 2008}} Zulkifli was secretary general of PAN's Central Board for 2005 to 2010.{{cite news|title=Zulkifli Hasan Jadi Sekjen PAN 2005-2010|url=https://nasional.tempo.co/read/59387/zulkifli-hasan-jadi-sekjen-pan-2005-2010|accessdate=3 April 2018|publisher=Tempo.co|date=11 April 2015}} On 8 October 2011, Zulkifli's oldest daughter Futri Zulya Savitri married PAN founder Amien Rais's third son, Ahmad Mumtaz Rais.{{cite news|title=Ketika Amien Rais dan Zulkifli Hasan Besanan|url=https://www.jpnn.com/news/ketika-amien-rais-dan-zulkifli-hasan-besanan|accessdate=3 April 2018|publisher=PT. JPG Multimedia|date=9 October 2011}} ==Forestry Minister== After President Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono was re-elected for a second term in 2009, Zulkifli was appointed forestry minister on 21 October 2009. He said his priorities would be the development of production forests (HTI and HTR), reducing forest fires by 20% annually, combating illegal logging, streamlining of overlapping regulations of the central government and regencies for forest sites, and improving forest industry institutions. He also said he would resist temptations and pressure from businessmen and politicians putting themselves before the public interest. “But temptations are always there everywhere. It’ll pose no problem to us if we just don’t pay attention to them,” he said.{{cite news|title=Zulkifli Hasan vows to live up to his political contract|url=http://www.pressreader.com/indonesia/the-jakarta-post/20091102/282956741238073|accessdate=3 April 2018|publisher=The Jakarta Post|date=2 November 2009}} Indonesia's Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) in 2012 declared the Forestry Ministry to be considered the country's most corrupt institution.{{cite news|title=Indonesia Struggles to Clean Up Corrupt Forestry Sector|url=http://jakartaglobe.id/news/indonesia-struggles-to-clean-up-corrupt-forestry-sector/|accessdate=4 April 2018|publisher=Jakarta Globe|date=1 January 2014}} To support efforts to eradicate corruption, Zulkifli issued circular No.SE.2 / Menhut-II / 2012 on Gratification Reporting at the Ministry of Forestry. The circular encouraged staff at the ministry to report the gratuities they receive to their superiors to report to first echelon officials and the KPK.{{cite news|last1=Snowdon|first1=Karon|title=Forestry Ministry Signs an MoU With KPK|url=https://en.tempo.co/read/news/2013/05/21/055482221/Forestry-Ministry-Signs-an-MoU-With-KPK}} Zulkifli served as forestry minister until 1 October 2014. ===Illegal forest operations=== In 2010, the Forestry Ministry promised to crack down on plantation companies operating without permits in Indonesia. In 2011, the ministry admitted hundreds of mining and plantation companies were operating in Central Kalimantan province without correct permits.{{cite news|title=Activists urge crackdown on 'forest mafia' networks|url=http://www.asia-pacific-solidarity.net/southeastasia/indonesia/netnews/2011/ind05v15.htm#Activists%20urge%20crackdown%20on%20'forest%20mafia'%20networks|accessdate=3 April 2018|publisher=Jakarta Globe|date=3 February 2011}} Zulkifli said the problem was due to misinterpretations of regional autonomy legislation introduced in 2001. Elfian Effendi of Greenomics Indonesia said it was difficult for the minister to stop the offending companies because they have political links.{{cite news|last1=Snowdon|first1=Karon|title=Indonesia admits hundreds of companies without forestry permits|url=http://www.radioaustralia.net.au/international/2011-02-02/indonesia-admits-hundreds-of-companies-without-forestry-permits/224918|accessdate=3 April 2018|publisher=ABC Radio Australia|date=2 February 2011}} The Forestry Ministry promised to stop issuing new plantation and mine permits in the province and to cooperate with the Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) to enforce the law.{{Citation needed|date=April 2018}} ===Moratorium on new forest concessions=== In January 2011, Zulkifli announced the Forestry Ministry would implement a 2-year moratorium on the issuance of permits for the conversion of primary and peat forests.{{cite news|title=Govt to implement forest conversion moratorium in January|url=https://en.antaranews.com/news/66951/govt-to-implement-forest-conversion-moratorium-in-january|accessdate=4 April 2018|publisher=Antara|date=13 January 2011}} Conservationists noted that on the eve of the logging moratorium, the ministry issued 2.9 million hectares of new plantation concessions to 44 firms.{{cite web|last1=Lang|first1=Chris|title=On the eve of the logging moratorium, Indonesia’s Ministry of Forestry issued almost three million hectares of concessions|url=http://www.redd-monitor.org/2011/01/26/on-the-eve-of-the-logging-moratorium-indonesias-ministry-of-forestry-issued-almost-three-million-hectares-of-concessions/|website=REDD-Monitor|publisher=Wordpress|accessdate=4 April 2018}} On 20 May 2011, President Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono signed a presidential decree putting the two-year moratorium into effect. The decree covered from 64 million to 72 million hectares of primary forest and peatland.{{cite web|last1=Stolle|first1=Fred|title=Indonesia’s Ambitious Forest Moratorium Moves Forward|url=http://www.wri.org/blog/2011/06/indonesia%E2%80%99s-ambitious-forest-moratorium-moves-forward|website=World Resources Institute|publisher=World Resources Institute|accessdate=4 April 2018}} ===Allegation of state losses=== In May 2013, the Indonesian Forum for Budget Transparency (Fitra) claimed data from the State Audit Agency (BPK) showed the Forestry Ministry had lost or misappropriated Rp 7.1 trillion ($731 million) in 2012. Zulkifli responded by saying the data and description of “losses” were inaccurate. He said the actual figure was Rp 6.2 trillion in non-tax revenue the ministry has been unable to collect since 2002. “We’re continuing to collect on those payments, both at the regional level and at the central level, and to date we’ve whittled down the outstanding amount to just Rp 2.1 trillion,” he said.{{cite news|title=Indonesian Ministers Deny Claims They Have Lost 8.3t Rupiah|url=http://jakartaglobe.id/news/indonesian-ministers-deny-claims-they-have-lost-8-3t-rupiah/|accessdate=4 April 2018|publisher=Jakarta Globe|date=3 May 2013}} ===Interview by Harrison Ford=== On 9 September 2013, Zulkifli was interviewed by [[Harrison Ford]] for part of a documentary series on climate change and the environment. Presidential adviser Andi Arief complained Ford had attacked the minister with rude questions. He accused Ford and his crew of “harassing state institutions” and threatened to deport him. Zulkifli said Ford was emotional because he wanted illegal loggers swiftly arrested at [[Tesso Nilo National Park|Tesso Nilo]] National Park in Sumatra. The minister said Ford did not give him sufficient time to explain the difficulties of catching those who violate forestry laws. He lamented they had not rehearsed the interview before filming commenced{{cite news|title=FM bemoans Harrison Ford's attitude|url=http://www.thejakartapost.com/news/2013/09/09/fm-bemoans-harrison-ford-s-attitude.html|accessdate=3 April 2018|publisher=The Jakarta Post|date=9 September 2013}}. Ford was making part of series on climate change called ''[[Years of Living Dangerously]]'' for US television network [[Showtime (TV network)|Showtime]].{{cite news|title=Harrison Ford shocks Indonesian minister with heated climate interview|url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/2013-09-10/indonesian-minister-shocked-at-harrison-ford-climate-interview/4949316|accessdate=3 April 2018|agency=AFP|publisher=ABC News|date=11 September 2013}} ===Hazardous smoke haze=== During Zulkifli's tenure as forestry minister, forests in Sumatra and Kalimantan were burned to clear land for plantations, causing hazardous haze that reached neighboring Singapore and Malaysia. In 2013, Kuntoro Mangkusubroto, the head of Indonesia's presidential working unit for development supervision and control, said many fires were on land owned by Asia Pulp and Paper (APP) and Asia Pacific Resources International Limited. Zulkifli said there was no strong evidence against the two companies.{{cite news|last1=Lim|first1=Leonard|title=MFA seeks answers from Jakarta to conflicting views on whether Singapore firms caused haze|url=http://www.straitstimes.com/singapore/mfa-seeks-answers-from-jakarta-to-conflicting-views-on-whether-singapore-firms-caused-haze|accessdate=8 April 2018|publisher=The Straits Times|date=25 June 2013}} In June 2013, Zulkifli blamed the severity of the haze on a five-year weather cycle. "Every five years, the weather becomes extremely dry. The wind is also much stronger and moves in a circular motion. So, when there is burning, fire spreads very quickly... Due to the dry season, it takes time for firefighters to locate the water sources. By the time water is irrigated to the hot spots, the fire would have spread."{{cite news|last1=Lim|first1=Joyce|title=Severity of haze 'due to 5-year cycle' of dry weather|url=http://www.asiaone.com/health/severity-haze-due-5-year-cycle-dry-weather|accessdate=8 April 2018|publisher=The Straits Times|date=28 June 2013}} Responding to allegations that plantation and forestry companies were responsible for the fires, Zulkifli was quoted by [[Tempo Magazine (Indonesia)|''Tempo'' magazine]] as saying the companies must be defended because they pay taxes.{{cite news|last1=Cahyadi|first1=Firdaus|title=When People's Safety are Sacrificed to Defend Companies|url=https://en.tempo.co/read/news/2013/07/07/080494143/When-Peoples-Safety-are-Sacrificed-to-Defend-Companies|accessdate=8 April 2018|publisher=Tempo.co|date=7 July 2013}} He said 14 people had been arrested on suspicion of starting fires, 11 of them linked to companies and three of them smallholders. "If proven guilty they could be jailed for five years and have their permits revoked," he said.{{cite news|title=Indonesia allocates Rp100 billion to overcome forest fires|url=https://en.antaranews.com/news/89602/indonesia-allocates-rp100-billion-to-overcome-forest-fires|accessdate=8 April 2018|publisher=Antara|date=28 June 2013}} In March 2014, Zulkifli supported calls by the National Police and Indonesian Military for the shooting of people found burning forests if they resist arrest. He acknowledged the people responsible for forest fires were seeking to open up new land for oil palm plantations.{{cite news|title=Forestry Minister Echoes Calls for Strict Action on Haze Issue|url=http://jakartaglobe.id/news/forestry-minister-echoes-calls-strict-action-haze-issue/|accessdate=8 April 2018|publisher=Jakarta Globe|date=18 March 2014}} In 2015, anti-haze activist Syahrul Fitra accused Zulkifli of allowing corporations to burn forests and causing the haze crisis. He claimed Zulkifli had allegedly given permission for the burning of over 1.3 million hectares of forests be used for plantations. He said law enforcers should arrest any officials responsible for the haze and called for an investigation into possible corruption in the issuance of permits. Zulkifli denied any wrongdoing.{{cite news|title=Former Indonesian Forestry Minister blamed by activist for haze crisis|url=http://www.todayonline.com/world/asia/former-indonesian-forestry-minister-blamed-activist-haze-crisis|accessdate=8 April 2018|publisher=Mediacorp Press Ltd|date=1 November 2015}} ===Riau forestry corruption case=== In August 2014, Zulkifli visited [[Riau]] province and encouraged proposals to change the status of forest land owned by locals so it could become part of 1,638,249 hectares allowed by the [[Indonesian Ministry of Forestry|Forestry Ministry]] for conversion into non-forest land. Riau governor Annas Ma'mun's administration responded by sending a proposal to Zulkifli, who gave his approval to some of the areas. Annas later revised the proposal, adding some land owned by palm-oil businessman Gulat Manurung, who paid a bribe of S$156,000 and Rp 500 million. Annas later stated Zulkifli had approved and issued the conversion permit.{{cite news|last1=Budiari|first1=Indra|title=MPR speaker faces more questions from KPK|url=http://www.thejakartapost.com/news/2014/11/13/mpr-speaker-faces-more-questions-kpk.html|accessdate=3 April 2018|publisher=The Jakarta Post|date=13 November 2014}} On 12 November 2014, Zulkifli was questioned as a witness by the [[Corruption Eradication Commission]] (KPK) in the case against Annas. Zulkifli denied approving the permit. Annas said he had been on his way to meet with Zulkifli when he was arrested by the KPK in a sting operation in September 2014.{{cite news|last1=Budiari|first1=Indra|title=Governor piles more allegations on Zulkifli|url=http://www.thejakartapost.com/news/2014/11/19/governor-piles-more-allegations-zulkifli.html|accessdate=3 April 2018|publisher=The Jakarta Post|date=19 November 2014}} Testifying at Annas's corruption trial in April 2015, Zulkifli admitted he had met with the director of PT Duta Palma, Surya Darmadi, to discuss a forest clearing permit. Surya was linked to the case by Gulat, who said he helped PT Duta Palma to meet with Annas to enable the company to convert 18,000 hectares of land.{{cite news|last1=S.|first1=Iqbal T. Lazuardi|title=Zulkifli Hasan Admits Meeting Company CEO|publisher=Tempo.co|date=8 April 2015}} Gulat was in February 2015 sentenced to three years in jail.{{cite news|last1=Movanita|first1=Ambaranie Nadia Kemala|title=Suap Gubernur Riau Rp 2 Miliar, Gulat Manurung Divonis Tiga Tahun Penjara|url=http://www.thejakartapost.com/news/2015/06/25/court-sentences-riau-governor-6-years-prison-corrupt.html|accessdate=3 April 2018|publisher=Kompas.com|date=23 February 2015}} Annas was in June 2015 sentenced to six years in jail.{{cite news|last1=Dipa|first1=Arya|title=Court sentences Riau governor to 6 years in prison for corrupt|url=http://www.thejakartapost.com/news/2015/06/25/court-sentences-riau-governor-6-years-prison-corrupt.html|accessdate=3 April 2018|publisher=The Jajkarta Post|date=25 June 2015}} ===Bogor land conversion case=== Zulkifli was questioned by the KPK on 11 November 2014 over the illegal issuance of a land conversion permit for a luxury housing project in [[Bogor Regency|Bogor]], [[West Java]]. The project was developed by property firm [[Sentul City, Indonesia|PT Sentul City]]. Former Bogor regent Rachmat Yasin received Rp 4.5 billion in bribes from Sentul City president director Kwee Cahyadi Kumala, who is president commissioner of property company PT Bukit Jonggol Asri (BJA), the main shareholder of Sentul City. KPK in December 2014 raided the Forestry Ministry to seize evidence. Zulkifli denied any wrongdoing. The Forestry Ministry's director general for planning, Bambang Supijanto, said Zulkifli had rejected BJA's proposal to convert nearly 3,000 acres of forest area for housing projects in Bogor because it lacked some requirements.{{cite news|last1=Halim|first1=Haeril|title=KPK raids ministry's office in land-conversion case|url=http://www.thejakartapost.com/news/2014/12/17/kpk-raids-ministry-s-office-land-conversion-case.html|accessdate=3 April 2018|publisher=The Jakarta Post|date=17 December 2014}} ===Forest smallholdings and education=== Zulkifli sought to improve the performance and image of the Forestry Ministry through two programs: one targeting the growth of agriculture through smallholdings in forest areas, and the other promoting environmental education. The first was the simplification of the application procedure for the development of smallholdings under the Community Nursery (''Kebun Bibit Rakyat'', KBR) scheme, introduced in 2010 and simplified in 2011.{{cite news |title=Prosedur Kebun Bibit Rakyat Dipermudah |url=https://ekonomi.kompas.com/read/2011/03/16/0352377/prosedur.kebun.bibit.rakyat.dipermudah |accessdate=6 August 2018 |publisher=Kompas Cyber Media |date=16 March 2011}} The second is the Forest Education program, which involves students visiting selected forest areas and planting trees.{{Citation needed|date=August 2018}} ===Flurry of decrees=== Conservation groups have alleged that after Joko Widodo had won Indonesia’s presidential election in July 2014, Zulkifli realized he would not retain his cabinet position because PAN was not part of the incoming ruling coalition, so he therefore started issuing more ministerial decrees, right up to his final week in office, when 100 decrees were signed. Many of the decrees granted new concessions for timber and logging companies, or allowed forest land to be used by oil palm plantation companies. Much of the land in question is in Papua province.{{cite web|title=September 29th 2014, a terrible day for Papua’s forests|url=https://awasmifee.potager.org/?p=1600|website=awasMIFEE!|publisher=awasMIFEE!|accessdate=4 April 2018}} Greenomics Indonesia said Zulkfli, during his tenure as minister, granted permits for 1.64 million acres of forest land to be used for farming, including for oil palm plantations.{{cite news|last1=Hendartyo|first1=Muhammad|title=Greenomics says PAN Cadre Granted More Land Permits Than Jokowi|url=https://en.tempo.co/read/news/2018/03/22/055916893/Greenomics-says-PAN-Cadre-Granted-More-Land-Permits-Than-Jokowi|accessdate=4 April 2018|publisher=Tempo.co|date=22 March 2018}} Zulkifli in March 2018 defended his action, saying Papua needed more land for sugar cultivation.{{cite news|last1=Novaria|first1=Astri|title=Respon Zulkifli Hasan Jawab Tudingan Greenomics|url=http://mediaindonesia.com/read/detail/151069-respon-zulkifli-hasan-jawab-tudingan-greenomics|accessdate=4 April 2018|publisher=Media Indonesia|date=23 March 2018}} ==MPR Speaker== On 8 October 2014, Zulkifli was sworn in as speaker of the People's Consultative Assembly (MPR) for the 2014-2019 period. His appointment was supported by [[Prabowo Subianto]]'s Red-and-White Coalition following Prabowo's loss of the [[Indonesian presidential election, 2014|2014 presidential election]] to [[Joko Widodo|Joko "Jokowi" Widodo]]. Although PAN was then a member of the opposition coalition, Zulkifli promised to uphold the interests of all Indonesians and not just those of his political supporters. Jokowi's coalition had wanted [[Oesman Sapta Odang]] as MPR speaker, but Zulkifli defeated Oesman by 347 to 330 votes.{{cite news|title=Zulkifli Hasan inaugurated as new speaker of People's Consultative Assembly|url=http://www.thejakartapost.com/news/2014/10/08/zulkifli-hasan-inaugurated-new-speaker-people-s-consultative-assembly.html|accessdate=3 April 2018|publisher=The Jakarta Post|date=8 October 2014}} One of Zulkifli's first tasks as MPR speaker was to lead the inauguration ceremony of Indonesia's seventh president, Joko Widodo, on 20 October 2014. He was credited for ensuring the event was attended by the losing presidential candidate Prabowo Subianto, who had vigorously rejected the election result.{{cite news|last1=Hariyadi|first1=Yoseph|title=Jokowi inaugurated as Indonesia's new president|url=https://en.antaranews.com/news/96163/jokowi-inaugurated-as-indonesias-new-president|publisher=The Jakarta Post|date=20 October 2014}} On 22 December 2014, Zulkifli said protests against then-Jakarta governor [[Basuki Tjahaja Purnama]], better known as Ahok, on the basis of his religion and race were unacceptable. Ahok, a Christian of Chinese ethnicity, faced opposition from conservative Muslim groups. "I strongly protest those who protest against Ahok because he's ethnic Chinese or because of his religion. If you want to criticize, go ahead, but do not make it about ethnicity, religion or race, as we are united in diversity," he said.{{cite news|title=Ketua MPR: Tak Boleh Ada yang Protes Ahok Karena Etnis dan Agamanya|url=https://news.detik.com/berita/d-2784784/ketua-mpr-tak-boleh-ada-yang-protes-ahok-karena-etnis-dan-agamanya|accessdate=5 April 2018|publisher=detikcom|date=22 December 2014}} ===Stance on alcohol and drugs=== In May 2016, Zulkifli called for tighter regulations on the sale of alcohol, saying it has negative social consequences, including death and crimes of obscenity.{{cite news|last1=Zulfikar|first1=Muhammad|title=Zulkifli Hasan: Peredaran Miras di Indonesia Harus Diatur|url=http://www.tribunnews.com/mpr-ri/2016/05/27/zulkifli-hasan-peredaran-miras-di-indonesia-harus-diatur|accessdate=8 April 2018|publisher=Tribunnews.com|date=27 May 2016}} Indonesia already bans the sale of alcohol to minors.{{cite news|last1=Wahyuningsih|first1=Merry|title=Tak Boleh Minum Bir Sebelum Umur 21 Tahun|url=https://www.cnnindonesia.com/gaya-hidup/20141031121011-255-9076/tak-boleh-minum-bir-sebelum-umur-21-tahun|accessdate=8 April 2018|publisher=CNN Indonesia|date=31 October 2014}} In January 2018, Zulkifli claimed eight parties in the national parliament were in favor of open alcohol sales at small shops. He said alcoholic drinks should be rejected firmly.{{cite news|title=Delapan Fraksi Setujui Penjualan Miras Secara Bebas|url=https://www.jawapos.com/read/2018/01/20/182792/delapan-fraksi-setujui-penjualan-miras-secara-bebas|accessdate=8 April 2018|publisher=PT Jawa Pos Grup Multimedia|date=20 January 2018}} In February 2016, Zulkifli called for smoking to be banned as it contributes to "ignorance and poverty".{{cite news|last1=Aco|first1=Hasanudin|title=Zulkifli Hasan: Stop Merokok!|url=http://www.tribunnews.com/nasional/2016/02/16/zulkifli-hasan-stop-merokok|accessdate=4 April 2018|publisher=TRIBUNnews.com|date=February 2016}} In March 2018, Zulkifli said drug traffickers should be shot dead, while drug users should be rehabilitated rather than imprisoned, as most of Indonesia's prison inmates are drug offenders.{{cite news|title=Tegas!! Zulkifli Hasan Sebut Bandar Narkoba Ditembak Mati|url=http://www.inikata.com/tegas-zulkifli-hasan-sebut-bandar-narkoba-ditembak-mati/|accessdate=8 April 2018|publisher=PT. Indo Network Intermedia|date=12 March 2018}} ===Opposition to LGBT=== In March 2016, Zulkifli said the lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender (LGBT) movement should have no place in Indonesia, but he warned against violence and discrimination. "As a movement, the existence of LGBT must be opposed. We must limit its room to move. However, as individual people, they must be protected like any other citizen," he said.{{cite news|last1=Nurbinato|first1=Bambang|title=More political leaders speak out against LGBT|url=http://www.thejakartapost.com/news/2016/03/04/more-political-leaders-speak-out-against-lgbt.html|accessdate=3 April 2018|publisher=The Jakarta Post|date=21 March 2016}} In January 2018, Zulkifli falsely claimed five parties in the House of Representatives were supporting a bill to legalize same-sex marriage. His statement was refuted by House speaker [[Bambang Soesatyo]]{{cite news|last1=La Batu|first1=Safrin|title=MPR speaker’s remarks on LGBT spark controversy|url=http://www.thejakartapost.com/news/2018/01/23/mpr-speaker-s-remarks-lgbt-spark-controversy.html|accessdate=3 April 2018|publisher=The Jakarta Post|date=23 January 2018}}, and prompted other major parties to affirm their opposition to gay rights.{{cite news|last1=Knight|first1=Kyle|title=Why criminalizing LGBT relationships is misguided|url=http://www.atimes.com/criminalising-lgbt-relations-indonesia-preposterous/|accessdate=3 April 2018|publisher=Asia Times|date=14 February 2018}}{{cite news|title=Protecting LGBTs|url=https://en.tempo.co/read/news/2018/02/06/314915509/Protecting-LGBTs|accessdate=3 April 2018|publisher=Tempo.co|date=6 February 2018}} ==Chairman of PAN== PAN held a congress in Bali over 28 February to 2 March 2015 to choose a chairman for the 2015-2020 period. Among those considered contenders were Zulkifli, then-incumbent chairman Hatta Rajasa and deputy chairman Dradjad Wibowo.{{cite news|title=Tiga Nama Calon Ketua Umum PAN|url=https://nasional.kompas.com/read/2014/12/18/09333521/Tiga.Nama.Calon.Ketua.Umum.PAN|accessdate=3 April 2018|publisher=Komps.com|date=18 December 2014}} Zulkifli announced his candidacy on 19 January 2015 in Surabaya. The Chairman of PAN's Youth Front Advisory Council, Hanafi Rais, said Zulkfli wanted the party to focus on defending the interests of the people, as well as giving local party officials full authority in determining regional leadership boards, and improving the performances of regional heads.{{cite news|last1=Stefanie|first1=Christie|title=Deklarasi Ketua Umum PAN, Zulkifli Hasan Bawa 4 Gagasan|url=https://www.cnnindonesia.com/nasional/20150121121055-32-26195/deklarasi-ketua-umum-pan-zulkifli-hasan-bawa-4-gagasan|accessdate=3 April 2018|publisher=CNN Indonesia|date=21 January 2015}} On 1 March 2015, Zulkifli was narrowly elected PAN chairman, receiving 292 votes, while Hatta Rajasa received 286 votes.{{cite news|last1=Aritonang|first1=Margareth S.|title=MPR speaker elected new PAN chief|url=http://www.thejakartapost.com/news/2015/03/02/mpr-speaker-elected-new-pan-chief.html|accessdate=3 April 2018|publisher=The Jakarta Post|date=2 March 2015}} After his election, Zulkifli insisted PAN would remain part of Prabowo Subianto's opposition coalition.{{cite news|last1=Sihaloho|first1=Markus Junianto|title=PAN Will Remain in Opposition, New Chairman Zulkifli Says|url=http://jakartaglobe.id/news/pan-will-remain-opposition-new-chairman-zulkifli-says/|accessdate=3 April 2018|publisher=Jakarta Globe|date=2 March 2015}} On 2 September 2015, Zulkifli announced PAN was switching its allegiance to Jokowi's ruling coalition in order to help the government's programs succeed.{{cite news|title=PAN Officially Switches Sides, Joins Jokowi's Coalition|url=http://jakartaglobe.id/news/pan-officially-switches-sides-joins-jokowis-coalition/|accessdate=3 April 2018|publisher=Jakarta Globe|date=2 September 2015}} On 9 August 2018, Zulkifli shifted PAN's allegiance back to Prabowo amid allegations that Prabowo's running mate for the 2019 presidential election, Sandiaga Uno, had paid Rp 500 billion to PAN in order to secure his nomination. PAN denied the allegation.{{cite news |last1=Saputro |first1=Febrianto Adi |title=PAN actually wants Anies Baswedan to run with Prabowo |url=https://www.republika.co.id/berita/en/national-politics/18/08/23/pdxafc414-pan-actually-wants-anies-baswedan-to-run-with-prabowo |accessdate=25 August 2018 |publisher=Republika.co.id |date=24 August 2018}}{{cite news |title=PAN, PKS deny getting Rp 500b to let Sandiaga become VP candidate |url=http://www.thejakartapost.com/news/2018/08/09/pan-pks-deny-getting-rp-500b-to-let-sandiaga-become-vp-candidate.html |accessdate=25 August 2018 |publisher=The Jakarta Post |date=9 August 2019}} ===Money politics=== In February 2017, Zulkifli urged Indonesians to avoid all forms of money politics in regional elections. “The sovereignty and power are fully in the hands of the people. Do not trade it for money or staple foods,” he said.{{cite news|last1=Sihaloho|first1=Markus Junianto|title=MPR Speaker Zulkifli Hasan Calls on Public to Avoid Money Politics in Regional Elections|url=http://jakartaglobe.id/news/mpr-speaker-zulkifli-hasan-calls-on-public-to-avoid-money-politics-in-regional-elections/|accessdate=4 April 2018|publisher=Jakarta Globe|date=14 February 2017}} On 6 March 2018, Zulkifli was filmed giving money to women in a public transport vehicle at a market in [[Muara Enim Regency|Muara Enim]] in [[South Sumatra]] province, ahead of the election for the regent of Muara Enim. He was accompanied at the market by regency head candidate Syamsul Bahri, who is supported by PAN.{{cite news|title=Adriansyah Laporkan Balik Cabub Syamsul Bahri Ke Polres Muara Enim|url=http://www.palugadanews.com/2018/03/adriansyah-laporkan-balik-cabub-syamsul-bahri-ke-polres-muara-enim/|accessdate=7 April 2018|publisher=Palugadanews.com|date=5 March 2018}}{{cite news|last1=Inge|first1=Nefri|title=PAN Bantah Zulkifli Hasan Lakukan Politik Uang di Pilkada Muara Enim|url=http://www.liputan6.com/pilkada/read/3373367/pan-bantah-zulkifli-hasan-lakukan-politik-uang-di-pilkada-muara-enim|accessdate=4 April 2018|publisher=Liputan6.com|date=14 March 2018}} The Election Supervisory Agency (Panwaslu) of Muara Enim conducted an investigation and attempted to summon Zulkifli for questioning but he was too busy to attend.{{cite news|last1=Inge|first1=Nefri|title=Terekam Bagi-Bagi Duit, Zulkifli Hasan Akan Diperiksa Panwas Muara Enim|url=http://www.liputan6.com/pilkada/read/3370498/terekam-bagi-bagi-duit-zulkifli-hasan-akan-diperiksa-panwas-muara-enim|accessdate=4 April 2018|publisher=Liputan6.com|date=14 March 2018}} PAN officials denied the handing out of money in the presence of the candidate constituted money politics, arguing Syamsul Bahri's presence was his own initiative.{{cite news|last1=Inge|first1=Nefri|title=PAN Bantah Zulkifli Hasan Lakukan Politik Uang di Pilkada Muara Enim|url=http://www.liputan6.com/pilkada/read/3373367/pan-bantah-zulkifli-hasan-lakukan-politik-uang-di-pilkada-muara-enim|accessdate=4 April 2018|publisher=Liputan6.com|date=14 March 2018}} Panwaslu later concluded Zulkifli had not been trying to influence voters to choose a particular candidate.{{cite news|last1=Inge|first1=Nefri|title=Alasan Panwas Muara Enim Bebaskan Zulkifli Hasan|url=http://www.liputan6.com/pilkada/read/3382311/alasan-panwas-muara-enim-bebaskan-zulkifli-hasan|accessdate=4 April 2018|publisher=Liputan6.com|date=18 March 2018}} ===Presidential ambition=== In February 2018, Zulkifli said he would be ready to contest Indonesia's [[Indonesian presidential election, 2019|2019 presidential election]] if he is nominated.{{cite news|last1=Triansyah|first1=Isra|title=Zulkifli Hasan Siap Maju Capres jika Diusung PAN|url=https://nasional.sindonews.com/read/1283700/12/zulkifli-hasan-siap-maju-capres-jika-diusung-pan-1519128456|accessdate=4 April 2018|publisher=SINDOnews.com|date=20 February 2018}} He later acknowledged any presidential nominee would likely require the backing of a coalition of parties.{{cite news|last1=Purbaya|first1=Angling Adhitya|title=Zulkifli Perhitungkan Syarat Kursi 20% Untuk Ikut Pilpres|url=https://news.detik.com/berita-jawa-tengah/d-3943561/zulkifli-perhitungkan-syarat-kursi-20-untuk-ikut-pilpres|accessdate=4 April 2018|publisher=detikcom|date=29 March 2018}} In April 2018, he said he would be PAN's presidential candidate, despite speculation the party might choose former military commander [[Gatot Nurmantyo]].{{cite news|last1=Bayhaqi|first1=Ahda|title=Zulkifli Hasan sebut PAN tak akan usung Gatot di Pilpres 2019|url=https://www.merdeka.com/politik/zulkifli-hasan-sebut-pan-tak-akan-usung-gatot-di-pilpres-2019.html|accessdate=4 April 2018|publisher=Merdeka.com|date=4 April 2018}} PAN ended up supporting Prabowo Subianto for the 2019 presidential election.{{cite news |title=Zulkifli Hasan Reveals Prabowo-Sandiaga Campaign Team |url=https://en.tempo.co/read/news/2018/08/18/055920916/Zulkifli-Hasan-Reveals-Prabowo-Sandiaga-Campaign-Team |accessdate=25 August 2018 |publisher=Tempo.co |date=18 August 2018}} ==Personal life and family== Zulkifli is married to Soraya and they have four children: Futri Zulya Savitri, Zita Anjani, Farras Nugraha and Rafi Haikal. Oldest daughter Futri Zulya Savitri studied in Australia, married a son of Amien Rais and runs a family business making household and kitchen appliances.{{cite news|last1=Suryadi|first1=Dede|title=Liku-liku Futri Membenahi Haneda|url=https://swa.co.id/swa/profile/profile-entrepreneur/liku-liku-futri-membenahi-haneda|accessdate=4 April 2018|publisher=SWA Online Magazine|date=11 February 2017}} Oldest son, Farras Nugraha, studied in the UK and is now a businessman. In September 2017, Farras married Milka Anisya Norosiya. Among their wedding guests were military commander General [[Gatot Nurmantyo]] and senior politicians Oesman Sapta Odang, Amien Rais, [[Hidayat Nur Wahid]], [[Aburizal Bakrie]] and [[Akbar Tandjung]].{{cite news|last1=Laksana|first1=Bisma Alief|title=Panglima TNI Hingga Ketua DPD Jadi Saksi Nikah Putra Zulkifli Hasan|url=https://news.detik.com/berita/3655732/panglima-tni-hingga-ketua-dpd-jadi-saksi-nikah-putra-zulkifli-hasan|accessdate=4 April 2018|publisher=detikcom|date=24 September 2017}} Zulkifli's second daughter, Zita Anjani, studied in London and in 2015 opened an early learning school called Kids Republic. His youngest child, Rafi Haikal, chose to study architecture in New York.{{cite news|last1=Septianto|first1=Bayu|title=Dari Kursi Bisnis ke MPR, Zulkifli Hasan Ingin Bangun Sekolah di Masa Tua|url=https://news.okezone.com/read/2018/01/20/337/1847853/dari-kursi-bisnis-ke-mpr-zulkifli-hasan-ingin-bangun-sekolah-di-masa-tua|accessdate=4 April 2018|publisher=Okezone News|date=20 January 2018}} ===Brothers=== Zulkifli has four brothers, including three who also became politicians: Zainudin Hasan (born 1965), Hazizi (1976) and Helmi Hasan (1979). The oldest brother in the family is Herli Hasan. Helmi Hasan, who became mayor of Bengkulu in 2013, viewed Zulkifli not only as an older brother but also as a parent to be obeyed and respected.{{cite news|title=Dibalik “Insya Allah” Helmi Hasan|url=http://bengkuluekspress.com/dibalik-insya-allah-helmi-hasan/|accessdate=8 April 2018|publisher=Bengkuluekspress.com|date=21 January 2013}} Zulkifli, Helmi and Zainudin founded Insan Cendikia Kalianda Lampung Indonesia Foundation, which built a free school for children from poor families in Lampung.{{cite news|last1=Supriyadi|first1=Eko|title=Zulkifli Hasan Tinjau SMA Kebangsaan di Lampung|url=http://www.republika.co.id/berita/mpr-ri/berita-mpr/16/03/17/o46sy3254-zulkifli-hasan-tinjau-sma-kebangsaan-di-lampung|accessdate=8 April 2018|publisher=republika.co.id|date=17 March 2016}} In March 2015, Helmi Hasan was declared a suspect by Bengkulu Attorney General's Office for allegedly embezzling Rp 11.4 billion ($870,000) of social aid from the city's 2012-2013 budget.{{cite news|title=Bengkulu Mayor Named Corruption Suspect|url=http://jakartaglobe.id/news/bengkulu-mayor-named-corruption-suspect/|accessdate=8 April 2018|publisher=Jakarta Globe|date=18 March 2015}} Helmi filed a pre-trial motion, which was accepted on 9 September 2015 by Bengkulu City State Court, so he did not stand trial.{{cite news|last1=Supriatin|title=Pengadilan batalkan status tersangka wali kota Bengkulu Helmi Hasan|url=https://www.merdeka.com/peristiwa/pn-bengkulu-batalkan-status-tersangka-wali-kota-bengkulu-helmi-hasan.html|accessdate=8 April 2018|publisher=Merdeka.com|date=10 September 2015}} The former head of Bengkulu City's Office for Management of Regional Revenue, Finance and Assets, M. Sofyan, in September 2017 testified Bengkulu Regional Secretary, Marjon, had ordered him to release Rp 500 million in state funds to pay for the success of Helmi's pre-trial motion.{{cite news|last1=Rahmadani|first1=Yetti|title=Terkuak, Rp 500 Juta Selamatkan Helmi Hasan Dari Praperadilan Bansos|url=http://www.rmolbengkulu.com/read/2017/09/06/4705/Terkuak,-Rp-500-Juta-Selamatkan-Helmi-Hasan-Dari-Praperadilan-Bansos-|accessdate=8 April 2018|publisher=Rakyat Merdeka Online|date=6 September 2017}} In December 2015, Zainudin Hasan was elected regent of South Lampung regency for the 2016-2021 period.{{cite news|last1=Mualifah|first1=Siti|title=Zainuddin-Nanang Menangi Pilkada Lampung Selatan Versi KPU|url=http://www.jejamo.com/zainuddin-nanang-menangi-pilkada-lampung-selatan-versi-kpu.html|accessdate=8 April 2018|publisher=jejamo.com|date=16 December 2015}} In February 2017, police in Bandar Lampung city named a Hazizi a fraud suspect for allegedly asking a contractor to pay a bribe of Rp 515 million in order to obtain a contract for infrastructure projects worth Rp 3.5 billion in South Lampung regency, where his brother Zainudin is regent.{{cite news|title=Pernah Tersangka Penipuan Proyek Hazizi mundur dari dewan|url=https://be1lampung.com/propinsi/pernah-tersangka-penipuan-proyek|accessdate=8 April 2018|publisher=PT Besatu Lampung Media|date=14 May 2017}} The contractor, Syahruddin, died in May 2016 without ever receiving the allegedly promised contract. His eldest son later reported Hazizi to police.{{cite news|last1=Rinando|first1=Romi|title=Hazizi, Adik Ketua MPR Zulkifli Hasan Ditetapkan Tersangka Kasus Dugaan Penipuan Proyek|url=http://lampung.tribunnews.com/2017/02/10/hazizi-adik-ketua-mpr-zulkifli-hasan-ditetapkan-tersangka-kasus-dugaan-penipuan-proyek|accessdate=8 April 2018|publisher=Tribun Lampung|date=10 February 2017}} In May 2017, Hazizi resigned from his seat in Lampung legislative assembly "for no specific reason" apart from "wanting to concentrate on worship", according to one of his colleagues in PAN.{{cite news|last1=Yulianto|first1=Beni|title=Adik Kandung Ketua MPR Mengundurkan Diri dari DPRD Lampung|url=http://lampung.tribunnews.com/2017/05/09/adik-kandung-ketua-mpr-mengundurkan-diri-dari-dprd-lampung|accessdate=8 April 2018|publisher=Tribun Lampung|date=9 May 2017}} ===Martial arts=== Zulkifli is a practitioner of [[Kyokushin|kyokushin]], a type of full contact karate. He served as chairman of the Board of Supervisors of Kyokushinkan International Indonesia. In June 2010, he received an honorary black belt from the supreme leader of Kyokushin International.{{cite web|title=Honorary Black-Belt submission to H. Zulkifli Hasan SE. MM.|url=http://www.kyokushinkan-indonesia.org/eng/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=36&Itemid=38|website=Kyokushinkan Indonesia|publisher=Kyokushinkan Indonesia|accessdate=9 April 2018}} Zulkifli is also a practitioner of [[Tarung Derajat]], a full body contact Indonesian mixed martial art. He was chairman of the Tarung Derajat Sports Family from 2010-2014.{{cite news|title=Tarung Derajat Tampil di SEA Games 2011|url=https://sport.tempo.co/read/252294/tarung-derajat-tampil-di-sea-games-2011|accessdate=9 April 2018|agency=Tempo.co|date=2 June 2010}} ==Honors== On 26 July 2007, Jakarta's PPM School of Management presented Zulkifli with the Kadarman Award, which is given to successful alumni.{{cite news|title=Sekjen DPP PAN Zulkifli Hasan Terima Kadarman Award|url=https://news.detik.com/berita/809996/sekjen-dpp-pan-zulkifli-hasan-terima-kadarman-award?nd771104bcj=|accessdate=3 April 2018|publisher=detikcom|date=26 July 2007}} On 8 July 2010, Zulkifli received a nobility title from Solo Palace in Central Java. He was bestowed the title of Kanjeng Pangeran (Prince) Noto Wononagoro for his efforts to preserve Javanese culture.{{cite news |last1=Amri |first1=Arfi Bambani |title=Jupe dan Zulkifli Hasan Dapat Gelar Bangsawan |url=https://www.viva.co.id/berita/nasional/163297-jupe-dan-zulkifli-hasan-dapat-gelar-bangsawan |accessdate=6 August 2018 |publisher=PT Viva Media Baru |date=8 July 2010}} In August 2014, President Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono presented Zulkifli with the Bintang Jasa Mahaputra Adipradana medal for his services to the country.{{cite web|title=Menhut Menerima Bintang Jasa Mahaputra Adipradana|url=http://www.forda-mof.org/index.php/berita/post/1795|website=Ministry of Environment and Forestry Republic of Indonesia|publisher=Badan litbang & Inovasi Kementerian Lingkungan Hidup & Kehutanan|accessdate=8 April 2018}} On 15 November 2017, Zulkifli was awarded the title of Pangeran Kerta Jaya Alam Nata from an organization of residents of [[Lubuklinggau]] in South Sumatra. The title, which means the leader of the people who carries out the mandate, was presented to him for "consistently defending the people". Organizers said Zulkifli is the only person to receive the title.{{cite news |last1=Tambak |first1=Ruslan |title=Zulkifli Hasan Satu-satunya Yang Diberi Gelar Pangeran Kerta Jaya Alam Nata |url=https://www.rmol.co/read/2017/11/15/314583/Zulkifli-Hasan-Satu-satunya-Yang-Diberi-Gelar-Pangeran-Kerta-Jaya-Alam-Nata- |accessdate=6 August 2018 |publisher=Rakyat Merdeka Online |date=15 November 2017}} == See also == * [[Ministry of Forestry (Indonesia)|Ministry of Forestry of the Republic of Indonesia]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://zulkiflihasan.info/ Official website] {{Leaders of Indonesian political parties}} {{s-start}} {{s-off}} {{succession box| title=[[Forestry minister]] of [[Indonesia]] | before=[[Malam Sambat Kaban]] | after=[[Chairul Tanjung]]| years=2009–2014}} {{s-bef|before=[[Sidarto Danusubroto]]}} {{s-ttl|title=Speaker of the People's Consultative Assembly|years=2014–present}} {{s-inc}} {{s-end}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Hasan, Zulk}} [[Category:1962 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Lampung]] [[Category:Government ministers of Indonesia]] [[Category:National Mandate Party politicians]] [[Category:Opposition to same-sex marriage]]
